stadium.name: The High-Pass Pitch
stadium.description: A field built at a breathtaking altitude in a fortified mountain pass. The air is painfully thin, and the weather is dangerously unpredictable.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying a small, hand-carved wooden bird to their gear.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.

stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

preGame:
# üéôÔ∏è LIVE FROM THE TOP OF THE WORLD! IT'S TUESDAY NIGHT TROLLBALL! üéôÔ∏è

Well hello there, sports fans! This is Nok the Corrupter, coming to you with a real humdinger of a showdown! We are perched precariously at the High-Pass Pitch for Game 5 of this Winners Bracket clash! The air is thinner than the excuses of a captured rogue, and if the altitude doesn't get you, the Vertigo surely will! It is a do-or-die atmosphere, folks! The series is on the line, and the tension is thicker than a swamp giant‚Äôs neck! 

Our visitors, **Oak & Onslaught**, are currently the darlings of the realm! I haven't seen popularity like this since someone accidentally left the vault door open at the Church of Pecune! I just saw Milt Casady leading the squad in a synchronized chant that‚Äôs probably causing avalanches three peaks over! And look at Wynnie Faina and Normi Glaudia‚Äîthose crazy kids are wearing their boots on the wrong feet again! üëü If that doesn't scream 'Warden-backed excellence,' I don't know what does! Symer Crissy is already giving the Trollball a heroic backstory; I hope it includes a chapter on how it‚Äôs about to be spiked into the ground! üå≥üí•

On the other side, **The Oread's Summit Tamers** are looking to defend their home turf, though their fan section is looking a bit... well, non-existent! Zero popularity points? Ouch! That‚Äôs colder than the frost on Geth the Gravelord‚Äôs toes! Mitran Mariand is busy exchanging well-wishes with his opponents‚Äîhonestly, where is the malice? Where is the demonic spite? üòà At least Odericus Juxon is slapping her own helmet until her ears ring‚Äînow that's a ritual I can get behind! 

With Sir Randy probably watching from a distance with that fancy, over-designed bow of his, the Wardens' prestige is at stake! Can the Tamers pull off a miracle in the thin air, or will Oak & Onslaught steamroll their way to the next bracket? Grab your goggles and your grog, because we are ready for some beautiful, mountain-top carnage! üèîÔ∏è‚öîÔ∏èüèà
postGame:
### üèüÔ∏è THE SUMMIT IS CONQUERED! OAK & ONSLAUGHT SWEEP THE SERIES! üèüÔ∏è

Boy-oh-boy, what a magnificent display of unbridled ferocity! Oak & Onslaught didn't just win; they absolutely dismantled the Oread's Summit Tamers with a 4-0 shutout that will be talked about in the taverns for decades! We saw teeth flying, armor buckling, and enough injuries to keep Ahron Latashia busy until the next era of the Everwar! The mountain air might be thin, but the action was heavy, and the Tamers just couldn't find their footing on their own High-Pass Pitch! üèîÔ∏è‚ú®

The game started with a frantic scramble for possession. Abner Seidel snagged the leather head early, showing off those lucky garish undergarments as he bobbed and weaved through the center! But the real fireworks began when the hitting started. Normi Glaudia, perhaps inspired by the druids' shifting terrain, delivered a bone-shattering tackle to Dric Trilley that sent her straight to the dirt with a nasty injury! ü¶¥ It was a clear message: the Wardens weren't here for the view; they were here for the violence!

Not to be outdone in the mayhem department, Wynnie Faina‚Äîdespite his boots being on the wrong feet‚Äîabsolutely leveled Clippard Burr! It was a crunching blow that had the few goats in attendance bleating in terror! The Tamers tried to mount a response, with Alwyn Wandy lining up a long-distance shot that could have changed the momentum, but the thin air must have messed with his aim because it sailed wide left! The first half was a defensive slugfest where the grass was stained greener than a Fey circus tent! ü§°üõ°Ô∏è

After the halftime break, where the healers worked their miraculous (and frankly, annoying) magic to bring the fallen back to life, the intensity only ramped up! Alwyn Wandy came out looking for blood and found it, tackling Millham Evangeline so hard she was out of the play before she could even stick another feather in her plume! It was a momentary spark for the Tamers, but it was quickly snuffed out by the overwhelming pressure of the Oak & Onslaught defense! üöëüî•

Ema Ulrick, swinging her cutlass like a woman possessed, decided Edme Virgil had spent enough time on the field. She delivered a tackle that sent Virgil back to see Carn Tibbetts for more emergency stitching! The Oread side was falling apart faster than Governor-King Zenku‚Äôs composure during a mask fitting! The Wardens' 'Natural Advantages' were on full display as they controlled every inch of the shifting gully! üå≥‚öîÔ∏è

Then came the scoring! Milt Casady, the chant-leading captain himself, found a gap in the center field defense. He didn't hesitate, launching a beautiful throw that zipped through the goal for a 2-point score! üéØ The crowd (well, the Onslaught fans who hiked all the way up here) went absolutely wild! It was a display of precision that would make Sir Randy‚Äôs fancy bow look like a child‚Äôs toy! The Tamers looked winded, gasping for oxygen that just wasn't there!

But wait, there‚Äôs more! Wynnie Faina wasn't finished with Edme Virgil. As soon as the poor soul stepped back onto the pitch, Faina was there to deliver another punishing tackle, injuring Virgil for the second time in one match! Talk about a bad day at the office! That kind of repetitive cruelty is exactly why I love this game, folks! It‚Äôs not just about the ball; it‚Äôs about making sure the other guy can‚Äôt walk for a week! üè•üî®

Milt Casady decided to put the final nail in the mountain's coffin. He broke away into the Home 2-Point zone and launched another spectacular shot that hit nothing but net! Another 2 points on the board, bringing the lead to a commanding 4-0! The Tamers were left standing there looking as confused as Sir Tanos in a library! It was a masterclass in playoff dominance, pure and simple! üìçüí•

As the final whistle echoed across the peaks, the scoreboard told the story of a complete and total shutout. The Oread's Summit Tamers, despite their mountain-top advantage and sea shanties, couldn't put a single point on the board. They‚Äôll be heading down to the Losers Bracket with more than a few bruises and a lot of questions about their grocery lists! Oak & Onslaught, meanwhile, are celebrating like they just found a chest of Valos's gold! üßπüèÜ

I have to tip my horns to the Wardens; they played with the grit of a demon and the coordination of a well-oiled execution machine. Mitran Mariand‚Äôs polite well-wishes didn't do him much good when he was staring at the grass from a horizontal position! Maybe next time the Tamers will try a little less grog and a little more 'fighting for your life.' But hey, that's the beauty of Trollball‚Äîthere‚Äôs always next week for more suffering! üòàüèà

This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the High-Pass Pitch! What a game, what a series, and what a glorious day for violence! I‚Äôm going to go see if I can find some of that non-alcoholic grog to dump on a hero's head. Remember, in Osterra, the only thing that stays dead is your dignity after a 4-0 loss! Stay nasty, sports fans! üåôüéôÔ∏èüëø
